availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Foster (Owen County, Kentucky, cooper, farmer, and soldier (11th KY Cav))

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, cooper, farmer, and soldier. Gallatin County, Kentucky, native. Son of Susan Foster. Married to Nancy E. Foster. Father of Alice B. Foster, Armilda Foster, James M. Foster, John M. Foster, William C. Foster, Julia Foster, and Marcellus Foster. Cooper in Owen County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in 1862. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a sergeant from September 22, 1862 to March 20, 1863. Discharged on account of disability on March 20, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 33.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, Owenton, p. 265B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0107.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 278-9.
